question: What did the poor boy beg for when he went to the king?
answer1: to be taken into service as a shepherd

question: What did everyone call the poor boy?
answer1: Sheep-Peter

question: How did Sheep Peter amuse himself while herding his sheep?
answer1: with his crossbow

question: Why did Sheep Peter agree to not shoot the crane?
answer1: She will help him whenever he is in trouble.

question: Who will come with Sheep Peter is in trouble?
answer1: Queen Crane

question: What did the king have to do because a war broke out?
answer1: take the field

question: What did Sheep-Peter ride into a swamp along the highway?
answer1: an old nag

question: Why did Sheep-Peter click with his tongue?
answer1: The horse died.

question: Where did Sheep-Peter go after the people had all passed by?
answer1: the oak in which the Queen Crane dwelt

question: Why did the king want to hold Sheep-Peter back?
answer1: He thought that an angel had come to help him.

question: Who helped Sheep-Peter defeat the enemy?
answer1: Queen Crane

question: What happened because Sheep-Peter forgot to say, "stay by me"?
answer1: He was shot in the leg.

question: What did the king do after Sheep-Peter was shot in the leg?
answer1: took out his handkerchief, and tied up his leg

question: How many times did Sheep-Peter save the king?
answer1: three times

question: Why did Sheep-Peter pretend to be sad when the soldiers laughed at him?
answer1: Sheep-Peter did not want them to know he was the one who saved the king.

question: Who had carried off the three princesses?
answer1: three meer-women

question: What did the king proclaim?
answer1: whoever could rescue the three princesses should receive one of them for a wife

question: What happened because Sheep-Peter rode away quickly after saving the princess?
answer1: No one knew he was the one who saved her.
answer2: People thought a nobleman saved the princess.

question: Where did Sheep-Peter lay down to sleep?
answer1: the sea-shore

question: What did the second princess weave into Sheep-Peter's hair?
answer1: a string of pearls

question: Why did the second princess tell the horse to wake Sheep-Peter?
answer1: He would not wake up at all.

question: How did the king feel when he heard his youngest daughter wanted to marry Sheep-Peter?
answer1: very angry

question: Why did the king feel very angry with his youngest daughter?
answer1: He did not believe for a moment that Sheep-Peter had delivered her.

question: Why did the king give nothing to Sheep-Peter?
answer1: He did not like Sheep-Peter.
answer2: He did not known Sheep-Peter saved his daughter.

question: What did the king hope for?
answer1: make a proper laughing-stock of himself, and drop far behind the others without any effort on their part.

question: How will the king feel when he finds out Sheep-Peter was the one who saved him and the princesses?
answer1: shocked

question: How did Sheep-Peter prove that he was the one who saved the king?
answer1: He drew out the king's handkerchief.

question: Who came along and told how it all had happened?
answer1: the youngest princess

question: Why did the king have to believe that Sheep-Peter saved the princesses?
answer1: Sheep-Peter took out the ribands of the other princesses.

question: What happened because Sheep-Peter proved what he did?
answer1: He got the youngest princess, and with her half the kingdom, and after the king's death, all of it.
